articles.headline: House Narrowly Approves Rules Amid Concerns About McCarthy’s Concessions
articles.snippet: After initially balking at a package of changes to House rules that enshrine concessions the speaker made to ultraconservative members, Republicans united to push them through.
articles.abstract: After initially balking at a package of changes to House rules that enshrine concessions the speaker made to ultraconservative members, Republicans united to push them through.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Republicans on Monday pushed through an overhaul of operating rules for the new Congress, overcoming the concerns of some rank-and-file members about concessions that Speaker Kevin McCarthy made to the hard right last week in the desperate and drawn-out process of securing his job.

articles.headline: 6-Year-Old Brought Gun From Home in Newport News School Shooting, Police Say
articles.snippet: The wounded teacher went to the school office and said “call 911” before collapsing, a witness said.
articles.abstract: The wounded teacher went to the school office and said “call 911” before collapsing, a witness said.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEWPORT NEWS, Va. — Abigail Zwerner was in the middle of a routine lesson at Richneck Elementary School last week when, the police said, a boy in her class, just 6 years old, pulled out a handgun at his desk, pointed it at his teacher and fired.
articles.byline: By Paul Bibeau, Sarah Mervosh and Campbell Robertson

articles.headline: Can Ron DeSantis Avoid Meeting the Press?
articles.snippet: The Florida governor easily won re-election despite little engagement with mainstream news outlets, another sign of partisan division ahead of the 2024 presidential race.
articles.abstract: The Florida governor easily won re-election despite little engagement with mainstream news outlets, another sign of partisan division ahead of the 2024 presidential race.
articles.lead_paragraph: Assigned to cover the re-election campaign of Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida, Miles Cohen, a young ABC News reporter, found himself stymied. The governor would not grant him an interview. Aides barred him from some campaign events and interrupted his conversations with supporters.

articles.headline: What to Know About Biden’s Income-Driven Repayment Proposal
articles.snippet: Proposed changes to federal student-loan repayment plans tied to income could cut some borrowers’ monthly payments by more than half.
articles.abstract: Proposed changes to federal student-loan repayment plans tied to income could cut some borrowers’ monthly payments by more than half.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Education Department on Tuesday released long-awaited details on a piece of President Biden’s student loan debt plan that would enable millions of borrowers to cut their monthly federal payments by more than half — perhaps the most consequential component of the president’s broader initiative to make the loan system more manageable.

articles.headline: The Marcos-Duterte Ticket Won. Can This Philippine Alliance Last?
articles.snippet: The two scions from notorious family dynasties clinched landslide election victories in 2022, but their power balance remains fragile.
articles.abstract: The two scions from notorious family dynasties clinched landslide election victories in 2022, but their power balance remains fragile.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAVAO CITY, the Philippines — When President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. hugged his vice-presidential running mate Sara Duterte at her inauguration in June, it looked like a euphoric moment in the Philippines: two of the nation’s most prominent political families coming together in the name of unity after landslide election victories.
articles.byline: By Sui-Lee Wee and Camille Elemia

articles.headline: As Infrastructure Money Lands, the Job Dividends Begin
articles.snippet: Trillions of dollars in government spending will profoundly affect the labor market, but in ways hard to measure, and mostly under the surface.
articles.abstract: Trillions of dollars in government spending will profoundly affect the labor market, but in ways hard to measure, and mostly under the surface.
articles.lead_paragraph: It has never exactly been boom times for the archaeology profession, but this past year comes close — thanks to Congress.

articles.headline: Three-Quarters of Teenagers Have Seen Online Pornography by Age 17
articles.snippet: Sexually explicit content has become so prevalent online that teenagers are deluged, according to a new report by a nonprofit child advocacy group.
articles.abstract: Sexually explicit content has become so prevalent online that teenagers are deluged, according to a new report by a nonprofit child advocacy group.
articles.lead_paragraph: The internet has transformed pornography, making it much easier to view and share than in the days of Playboy magazine and late-night cable television.

articles.headline: Soaked and Battered by Repeating Rainstorms, California Girds for More
articles.snippet: Extreme weather has plagued many parts of the country this fall and winter. But few places have been as ravaged by the changing climate these last weeks as California.
articles.abstract: Extreme weather has plagued many parts of the country this fall and winter. But few places have been as ravaged by the changing climate these last weeks as California.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — An unrelenting series of pounding storms over at least 11 days has left no part of California untouched — flooding towns from north to south, loading inland mountains with snow and transforming the often dry Los Angeles River into a raging channel.
articles.byline: By Victoria Kim, Soumya Karlamangla and Jacey Fortin

articles.headline: Failure of Britain’s First Space Launch Is a Setback to Emerging Industry
articles.snippet: When a Virgin Orbit rocket fell short of orbit, it dealt a blow to Britain’s space program and the companies whose satellites were lost in the mission.
articles.abstract: When a Virgin Orbit rocket fell short of orbit, it dealt a blow to Britain’s space program and the companies whose satellites were lost in the mission.
articles.lead_paragraph: The failed attempt to launch satellites into space from Britain for the first time has dealt a harsh blow to the country’s emerging space program.
